Major_Arcs.title: Circus Introduction and Paul Bunyan's Initial Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the circus setting, Paul Bunyan as a performer, and his first intervention against injustice, leading to a confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Arrival and Initial Wonder
sub_scenes.description: The circus comes to town, and the public, including Paul Bunyan and a family, are introduced to its wonders and spectacles.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Circus and the Giraffe

sub_scenes.title: Intervention and Ambush
sub_scenes.description: Paul Bunyan, after his performance, hears a cry for help and intervenes, leading to a fight and subsequent ambush.

narrative_arcs.title: Investigating the Cry for Help and Confronting Billings

Major_Arcs.title: New Strongman and Matto Grasso's Revenge
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the circus owner seeking a new strongman, leading to Paul Bunyan's recruitment and Matto Grasso's vengeful sabotage attempts.

sub_scenes.title: The Strongman Proposition
sub_scenes.description: A misunderstanding leads to the circus owner offering Paul Bunyan the strongman position after witnessing his strength.

narrative_arcs.title: The Proposition: Becoming the New Strong Man

sub_scenes.title: Matto Grasso's Sabotage
sub_scenes.description: Driven by envy, Matto Grasso plots and executes acts of sabotage against Paul Bunyan and the circus, starting with arson and then releasing an ape.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Acclaim and Matto Grasso's Envy
Matto's Renewed Sabotage: The Ape Release
Discovery of the Loose Ape and Paul's Intervention

sub_scenes.title: Further Circus Chaos
sub_scenes.description: The chaos at the circus escalates with more sabotage attempts, including a weight-throwing incident, while observers react to the ongoing events.

narrative_arcs.title: Arena Observation and Intention to Intervene

sub_scenes.title: Matto and Sonny's Fight and Paul's Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Matto Grasso confronts and fights Sonny, leading to a dangerous stunt involving a trapeze, ultimately resolved by Paul Bunyan and circus authorities.

narrative_arcs.title: Rejection of Strongman Offer and Departure

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Eastern Adventures: The Severed Head and Ogress
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Marco Polo and his fantastical adventures in the East, focusing on his encounter with a severed head and a dangerous ogress.

sub_scenes.title: Marco Polo in Tibet and the Talking Head
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo faces danger in Tibet and then encounters a bizarre and pleading severed head in a forest.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Awful Ogress of Tibet
Discovery of the Severed Talking Head
The Severed Head's Plea for Help

sub_scenes.title: Rescue, the Sacred Dagger, and Journey to Hi-Toun
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo rescues a man, receives a magical dagger, and continues his journey towards Hi-Toun, encountering a town in mourning.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Hi-Toun and King's Welcome
The King's Grief and the Missing Princess Lotus
Encounter with a Starving Mother and the Witch's Castle
Entering the Mysterious Castle and Meeting the 'Children'
Confrontation with the Mice and Sword Defense

sub_scenes.title: Princess Lotus Rescue and Royal Reward
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo, now a prisoner, encounters Princess Lotus and together they escape the Ogress, returning to her father and receiving a royal marriage proposal as reward.

narrative_arcs.title: Dungeon Escape and Journey to Father
Palace Arrival, Mourning Confusion, and Marriage Reward

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra and Jordan's Revenge
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a tale of hidden treasure, betrayal, and revenge set in a British penal colony and England.

sub_scenes.title: The Treasure Keeper's Tale and Penal Colony Setup
sub_scenes.description: A narrator introduces a story about treasure, followed by a scene in a British penal colony where a prisoner seeks a private audience with Captain Brooking.

narrative_arcs.title: Prison Colony Labor and Guard Check
Request to Speak with Captain Brooking

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal and Vow of Revenge
sub_scenes.description: Captain Brooking betrays the prisoner, escaping with the treasure map, leading to the prisoner's vow of revenge and eventual release.

narrative_arcs.title: Discovery of Betrayal and Captain's Escape
Release from Servitude and Fare to England
Arrival in England and Renewed Vengeance

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Fatal Treasure
sub_scenes.description: Jordan tracks down Captain Brooking, confronts him, and is led to the treasure, only for a deadly betrayal and fight to ensue.

narrative_arcs.title: Ascent to the Attic and Discovery of Treasure
Responding to Gunshot and Finding the Body
Aftermath and Calling the Homicide Squad
Moral of the Story: Money is Evil

Major_Arcs.title: Dr. Styx and the Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Dr. Styx and his investigation into the supernatural problems at the Matthews Estate, haunted by Vincent Matthews's vengeful spirit.

sub_scenes.title: Courtroom and Estate Introduction
sub_scenes.description: Dr. Styx is introduced, followed by a courtroom scene where Vincent Matthews is sentenced for murder, setting up the backstory for the haunted estate.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Warning at Matthews Place
Warning Before Entering the Haunted House

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Vincent Matthews' Ghost
sub_scenes.description: Henry Northrup and Dr. Styx enter the haunted Matthews Estate and are immediately confronted by the spectral form of Vincent Matthews.

narrative_arcs.title: Unexpected Strength and Shift in Power
The Horrifying Revelation of Rosalind's Murder and Forgiveness
Plea for Rest and Conditional Forgiveness
The Test of Brotherly Love and Rejection

Major_Arcs.title: Henry Hudson's Voyages and Mutiny
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc narrates the historical voyages of Henry Hudson, his relentless search for the Northwest Passage, and the tragic mutiny that befell him.

sub_scenes.title: First Voyage and Setback
sub_scenes.description: Introduction to Henry Hudson's ambition and his first voyage funded by the Dutch East India Company, ending in disappointment and return to Holland.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dutch East India Company's Request
Threat of Mutiny and Change of Course
Entering the Hudson River with Hope
Hudson's Resolve and Return to Holland

sub_scenes.title: Second Voyage and Tragic Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: Hudson's second voyage, leading to being icebound and eventually to a mutiny by his crew, resulting in his abandonment at sea.

narrative_arcs.title: New Company and Continued Search for Passage
Extreme Northerly Route and Icebound Ship
Winter Quarters and Waiting for Spring Thaw
The Ice Melts and Voyage Resumes
Crew's Refusal and Demand to Return Home
Mutineers Return Home and Face Justice

Major_Arcs.title: Hassan the Arabian Knight and the Rescue of the Caliph's Daughter
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Hassan the Arabian Knight on a dangerous mission to rescue the Caliph's daughter from the Dread Tartars, culminating in a trial by combat and a romantic resolution.

sub_scenes.title: The Caliph's Mission and Perilous Journey
sub_scenes.description: Hassan is summoned by the Caliph and tasked with a dangerous rescue mission, beginning his perilous journey into Tartar territory.

narrative_arcs.title: The Summons and the Dangerous Mission
The Rescue Mission: Daughter of Ali-Ben-Ali
Signs of the Enemy at the Oasis

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Capture at Tartar Camp
sub_scenes.description: Hassan stealthily approaches and infiltrates the Tartar camp, but is ultimately discovered and captured while attempting to contact the prisoner.

narrative_arcs.title: Approaching the Tartar Camp Under Nightfall
Cloak as a Disguise and Infiltration Plan
Reaching the Prisoner's Tent and Contact
Discovery and Confrontation by Tartar Guards
Capture and Recognition as an Outsider

sub_scenes.title: Trial by Combat and Romantic Conclusion
sub_scenes.description: Hassan faces Kurgan's challenge of trial by combat, triumphs, and secures the daughter's release, leading to a romantic farewell.

narrative_arcs.title: Terms of Combat and Kurgan's Doubt
Victory Shout and Defiant Last Words
Impending Departure and a Necessary Kiss
